chapters.title: Recording Introduction & Project Overview
chapters.description: The narrator begins by stating the date (May 3rd, 1986), explaining their attempt to record their life story, acknowledging potential errors and omissions, and outlining the scope of the project (covering 85 years of life, starting with childhood memories after leaving Iowa).

chapters.title: Move to Canada - 1907
chapters.description: Lindy begins recounting his family's move to Canada in 1907 when he was four and a half years old.

chapters.title: Farm Expansion and Childhood Transportation
chapters.description: Lindy describes the construction of the new house and its features (basement, dining room, living room).

chapters.title: Coyote Trading Begins
chapters.description: Lindy shifts the focus to his involvement in trading coyote and other animal pelts, and his efforts to find better prices.

chapters.title: Marriage and Floods in 1916-1917
chapters.description: Lindy details how others copied his fur trading business and the resulting end of his initial venture.

chapters.title: New Tractor Arrival
chapters.description: Lindy begins discussing the arrival of a new tractor on the farm and its novelty in the community.

chapters.title: Seeking Financial Assistance and Father's Illness
chapters.description: Lindy begins discussing his father's declining health, doctor visits, and subsequent hospitalization.; Lindy recounts needing financial assistance to travel to his father's hospital.

chapters.title: Early Radio and World War News
chapters.description: Lindy talks about the limited news about World War I and his first experience with a radio.

chapters.title: Father's Funeral in 1924
chapters.description: Lindy explicitly states he's going back to the year 1924 to discuss his father's death.

chapters.title: Taking Over the Farm After Dad
chapters.description: Lindy begins discussing taking over the farm after his father's death and the responsibilities involved.

chapters.title: Blacksmith Shop Visit
chapters.description: Lindy recounts a visit to the blacksmith shop with Cousin Jake and the ensuing rainstorm.

chapters.title: Becoming Top Production Man and Relocation
chapters.description: Lindy describes becoming the top production man on the power gang and moving around the country.

chapters.title: Narrator's Decision to Quit
chapters.description: Lindy informs his boss of his departure to assist Lori and expresses his dislike for the transient lifestyle.

chapters.title: Janie's Baby & Upcoming Trip to London
chapters.description: Lindy mentions visiting Janie and her new baby, and her plans to visit Norm in London.

chapters.title: Meeting the Threshing Machine Owner
chapters.description: Lindy describes his encounter with a renowned threshing machine owner and his decision to visit him.

chapters.title: Uncle's Compound Machine
chapters.description: Lindy transitions to discussing his work at his uncle's farm with a compound threshing machine.

chapters.title: Fetching Whiskey for Foreman
chapters.description: Lindy describes the unusual circumstances of his job, including a foreman who was often drunk and required Lindy to obtain whiskey.

chapters.title: High-Voltage Crew Encounter
chapters.description: Lindy recounts an encounter with a high-voltage crew and his hesitation to join them due to lack of experience.

chapters.title: Tape Recording Issues
chapters.description: Lindy acknowledges issues with the tape recording and his intention to avoid chronological order.

chapters.title: Work Assignment in Afghanistan
chapters.description: Lindy abruptly changes the subject to a job in Afghanistan, detailing his role as a head lineman.

chapters.title: Funeral and Farm Lunch
chapters.description: Lindy shifts to a story about a funeral in Halbright and a lunch provided for attendees at his farm.; Lindy discusses an incident involving his brother working on a car and a conversation overheard by important figures.

chapters.title: Crew Member Injury and Supervisor Arrival
chapters.description: Lindy discusses a crew member leaving to work for the coal company and Bill Wilson taking over.

chapters.title: Bill Wilson's Return
chapters.description: Lindy discusses Bill Wilson's return to work and his own return to Estevan.

chapters.title: Unemployment and Rosetown Duties
chapters.description: Lindy discusses the widespread unemployment and his responsibilities in Rosetown, including straightening the distribution system.

chapters.title: Power Plant Construction
chapters.description: Upon Lindy's return, he is asked to supervise the construction of a power plant.

chapters.title: Conflict with Management
chapters.description: Lindy recounts a confrontation with the general manager and his frustration with the power company's management.

chapters.title: Jack Dyer's Financial Troubles
chapters.description: Lindy begins discussing Jack Dyer's financial difficulties and dissatisfaction with running the power plant.

chapters.title: Power Plant Abandonment
chapters.description: Lindy discusses the abandonment of the power plant in Wiring and the construction of a new power line.

chapters.title: Dyer's Move to British Columbia After Business Failure
chapters.description: Lindy begins recounting Jack Dyer's subsequent move to British Columbia after leaving Tompkins.

chapters.title: Military Draft and Deferment Problems
chapters.description: Lindy discusses being drafted into the King's Army despite a deferment, and the subsequent confusion and resolution involving a general manager.

chapters.title: Generator Failure and Inspection
chapters.description: Lindy shifts the discussion to the company's relocation to the Peace River country and his responsibilities at Estevan.

chapters.title: Contracting History Delayed
chapters.description: Lindy states he will postpone detailing his contracting history and doesn't know when he'll return to the recording.

chapters.title: Future Contracting Outline
chapters.description: Lindy states his intention to provide an outline of what contracting was like for the next 18 years.

chapters.title: Early Career and Management Experience
chapters.description: Lindy discusses the challenges of piecing together recordings made over five years, which had been partially erased.

chapters.title: Airport Dismantling Job
chapters.description: Lindy transitions to discussing a specific job dismantling airports and the challenges involved.

chapters.title: Davidson Electric Work
chapters.description: Lindy moves on to describe work done for Dominion Electric in Davidson.

chapters.title: Pole Setting Process
chapters.description: Lindy describes the process of setting poles, including the use of machinery and the size of the poles.

chapters.title: Listening to Mulroney
chapters.description: Lindy shifts from discussing previous work to listening to Brian Mulroney and commenting on his speech about trade.

chapters.title: Returning to 1947 Work
chapters.description: Lindy transitions from describing the weather to discussing his first job in 1947, building a line from Weyburn to Radville.

chapters.title: Power Sends Boring Machine
chapters.description: Lindy transitions to describing the arrival of the power company's boring machine.

chapters.title: Sunday Work & Crew Discipline
chapters.description: Lindy describes an attempt to work on Sunday and the crew's subsequent behavior.

chapters.title: Early Job Locations and Construction
chapters.description: Lindy begins detailing a job near Swift Current in 1948.

chapters.title: Yorkton to Melville Line
chapters.description: Lindy describes the line from Yorkton to Melville and down to Kalele, and the challenges of completing it due to weather.

chapters.title: Years 1950-1952
chapters.description: Lindy transitions to a chronological recounting of his work, detailing the years 1950, 1951, and 1952, including mileage of line built and number of farms.

chapters.title: Farm Operation Changes
chapters.description: Lindy shifts from discussing large farm runs to a discussion of scattered filling operations and crew management.

chapters.title: River Crossing Project Details
chapters.description: Lindy transitions from discussing general work conditions to a specific joint bid on a high-voltage line from Shellbrook to Prince Albert.

chapters.title: Project Profitability Analysis
chapters.description: Lindy explains how he had his assistant review the Swift Current project's finances to determine profitability.

chapters.title: Death of Bill Zaharachuk & Business Partnerships
chapters.description: Lindy discusses the deaths of Ron Kennedy and Bill Zaharachuk and subsequent changes in company ownership.

chapters.title: Management and Team Dynamics in Contracting
chapters.description: Lindy begins to detail his early career experiences, working for different companies and learning from various foremen.

chapters.title: Lindy's Early Career and Progression
chapters.description: Lindy begins to discuss his career progression, starting with digging holes and working up to being a lineman, then into service and crew work.

chapters.title: Retained Journeyman Status
chapters.description: Lindy transitions to discussing his experience with inside wiring and obtaining his journeyman's papers.; Lindy explains how Art Miller's company keeps him on retainer due to his journeyman's paper.

chapters.title: Value of Mentorship
chapters.description: Lindy recounts a former employee's praise for his company and the valuable experience gained there.

chapters.title: Wage Increase and Training
chapters.description: Lindy describes a foreman offering him a raise to fifty cents an hour and introducing him to hotline work.

chapters.title: Incorporation and Salary Advice
chapters.description: Lindy shifts to discussing the incorporation of the company in 1953 and seeking advice from auditors regarding his salary.

summary: A personal memoir recording covering family memories and life stories.

stories.title: Initial Microphone Setup and Life History Recording
stories.description: Lindy adjusts microphone distance and experiments with recording quality.

stories.title: Temporary Housing and Travel to the Farm
stories.description: Lindy describes his family's initial living situation in a small-town hotel.

stories.title: Building a New House
stories.description: Lindy describes the new house his father built, detailing its layout and size.

stories.title: Starting a Track Line
stories.description: Lindy elaborates on the specifics of his trapping activities, including the types of animals he trapped.

stories.title: 1917-1918 Flu Pandemic
stories.description: Lindy transitions to recounting the severe influenza pandemic of 1917-1918 and its impact on his family and community.

stories.title: Grasshopper Infestation
stories.description: Lindy transitions to describing a significant grasshopper infestation and the efforts to combat it.

stories.title: Separator Argument
stories.description: Lindy shifts the narrative to an incident involving a separator and an argument between several individuals.

stories.title: Discussing Family Events and a Future Story
stories.description: Lindy explicitly states he is pausing the narrative and will return to the story of his father later.

stories.title: Reflecting on Early Childhood
stories.description: Lindy shifts to reminiscing about his early childhood experiences and memories.

stories.title: Witnessing a Fatal Train Accident
stories.description: Lindy recalls a traumatic event involving a runaway train and a tragic accident.

stories.title: Summer Interests
stories.description: Lindy transitions to talking about his summer interests, including baseball and wrestling.

stories.title: Disputes Over Compensation and Farm Management
stories.description: Lindy begins discussing his financial compensation for managing the farm and subsequent complaints from others.

stories.title: Power Gang Job Offer
stories.description: Lindy receives a tip about a job opening on a power gang and applies for the position.

stories.title: Lori Farmer's Difficult Situation
stories.description: Lindy encounters Lori, a farmer in distress, and decides to quit his job to help him with his crops.

stories.title: Nebraska Harvest Help
stories.description: Lindy recounts traveling to Nebraska to help his cousin with the harvest.

stories.title: Extreme Heat in Nebraska
stories.description: Lindy describes the intense heat he experienced during the Nebraska harvest in 1927.

stories.title: Visit to Larry's and Aberdeen
stories.description: Lindy recounts his travels after leaving Diener's, including a stop at Larry's and his journey to Aberdeen, South Dakota.

stories.title: Machine Breakdown and Repair
stories.description: Lindy details the breakdown of the threshing machine during the trial run and the subsequent repairs.

stories.title: Service Station Conversation
stories.description: Lindy relays a conversation he had with a service station attendant about his age and experience.

stories.title: Power Line Job Begins
stories.description: Lindy describes finding and starting a job on a power line in Loyola, North Dakota.

stories.title: Building Power Line North
stories.description: Lindy describes building a large power line across country, including the challenges of the terrain.

stories.title: Harvest Time and Separator
stories.description: Lindy shifts the discussion to harvest time and the need to return to Frederick to operate a separator.

stories.title: Tape Recording Issues and Line Construction
stories.description: Lindy expresses concerns about the recording process and potential duplication of information on separate tapes.

stories.title: Farm Finances and Paperwork
stories.description: Lindy shifts to discussing his interactions with immigration authorities and returning to the farm.

stories.title: January Date and Recollections
stories.description: Lindy states the date as January 30, 1981, and begins reminiscing about Christmas and the family's departure.

stories.title: Seeking Employment After the Harvest of 1929
stories.description: Lindy transitions to discussing his farming experience with Mac in the spring of 1929.

stories.title: Return to Farm and Mother
stories.description: Lindy describes returning to the farm and visiting his mother in Waverton.

stories.title: Workplace Dispute and Armed Protest
stories.description: Lindy transitions to a story about a labor dispute and his subsequent one-man strike.

stories.title: Crew Management and Work
stories.description: Lindy details his experience leading a crew and the work they performed that summer, including locations and equipment.

stories.title: Severe October Snowstorm
stories.description: Lindy recounts a severe snowstorm in October and its impact on the region.

stories.title: Power Commission Job Offer
stories.description: Lindy receives an offer from the power commission and puts in an application for a lineman position.

stories.title: District Supervisor Responsibilities
stories.description: Lindy is assigned to a district in Saskatoon and given responsibility for multiple towns.

stories.title: Iowa Trip with Mother
stories.description: Lindy decides to take a three-month leave to take his mother on a trip to Iowa.

stories.title: Timeline of Farm Work and Wiring Jobs (1932-1934)
stories.description: Lindy clarifies the timeline of his work, mentioning the year 1932.

stories.title: Financial Backing from Power Corp
stories.description: Lindy receives financial backing from the Power Corporation to purchase the Tompkins power plant.

stories.title: Virginia Electrics Job
stories.description: Lindy transitions to discussing his work for Virginia Electrics and the associated living arrangements.

stories.title: Preparing for an Electrician's Exam
stories.description: Lindy shifts the conversation to his experience taking and passing the electrician's exam in 1934.

stories.title: Power Commission Opportunity
stories.description: Lindy expresses his interest in working for the power commission and building power lines.

stories.title: Securing Initial Contracts
stories.description: Lindy details securing his first contracts for line construction from Halbrite to Midale and Estevan to South.

stories.title: Highdale and Estevan Projects
stories.description: Lindy details the two projects he bid on: the power line at Highdale 2 and the Estevan to Stoughton line.

stories.title: Acquiring a Truck
stories.description: Lindy describes how he acquired his first truck, highlighting the difficulty in obtaining one at the time.

stories.title: Bidding Process Details
stories.description: Lindy discusses the bidding process for the power line construction project, including the number of bids and the price differences.

stories.title: North Regina Work
stories.description: Lindy shifts to describing work performed for the Power Commission in North Regina.

stories.title: High Voltage Line Construction
stories.description: Lindy begins detailing the construction of a high voltage line.

stories.title: Relating Assistance to Men
stories.description: Lindy begins to describe how he secured help for the men working on the project, starting with a fellow named Jack Gardner.

stories.title: Detailing Pole Setting Process
stories.description: Lindy describes the process of setting poles, including hand tamping and the number of men involved.

stories.title: Decision Regarding Family Reunion
stories.description: Lindy shifts from discussing his 1947 work to recounting a family reunion in Oregon and the circumstances surrounding his decision to attend.

stories.title: New Job Offer and Negotiation
stories.description: Lindy transitions from the reunion to discussing a new job assigned by the superintendent, running from Kenora to Priestville and Norquay.

stories.title: Jockeying Between Jobs
stories.description: Lindy shifts to describing his efforts to manage both the Kenora and Dinsmore jobs before winter.

stories.title: Jack Gardner's Work Habits
stories.description: Lindy transitions to discussing Jack Gardner, a former employee, and his leadership style.

stories.title: Regina Return & Crew Pay
stories.description: Lindy recounts his return to Regina and the issue of paying the crew.

stories.title: Starting Work in 1948
stories.description: Lindy transitions to discussing the 1948 season and the challenges of securing jobs.

stories.title: Farm Electrification Projects
stories.description: Lindy shifts to discussing farm electrification projects and the number of farms they worked on.

stories.title: Alberta Farm Work
stories.description: Lindy transitions to discussing his work building farms in Alberta around Lloydminster and Beggarville.

stories.title: 1953 Farm Operations
stories.description: Lindy shifts to describing farm operations specifically in 1953, detailing the number of farms worked and the daily work routine.

stories.title: Bidding and 1959
stories.description: Lindy transitions to discussing bidding practices and the year 1959, explaining his refusal to bid below cost and the profitability of that year.

stories.title: Swift Current Project Details
stories.description: Lindy transitions from discussing the general timeline to detailing a specific, large project at Swift Current and the associated challenges.

stories.title: Contracting & Power Prices
stories.description: Lindy transitions to discussing the changing landscape of power contracting and rising prices.

stories.title: Recalling Visitors and Resuming Recording
stories.description: Lindy announces his intention to review his previous statements and generalize about past events.

stories.title: Life in Electrical Field
stories.description: Lindy transitions to discussing his experiences in the electrical field, describing it as a 'hectic time.'

stories.title: Technician vs. Electrician
stories.description: Lindy differentiates his electrical expertise from his lack of knowledge in other technical fields like radio and tape recorders.

stories.title: Early Wage Details
stories.description: Lindy begins discussing his early wages and working conditions in Worthington, Iowa.

stories.title: South Dakota Lineman Work
stories.description: Lindy transitions to discussing his work as a lineman in South Dakota and the associated wages and room/board.

stories.title: Early Employment and Wages
stories.description: Lindy shifts to discussing his time operating a power plant and the subsequent wage change.
